intro: Lasiorrhiza pulchella, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Lasiorrhiza pulchella is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
